Row.Text: My forefathers were warriors. Their son is a warrior. From them I take only my existence. I have made myself what I am.
You see a star that crosses the night sky like a bolt of lightning? That is me, Tecumseh, the one who leaps great distances.
You see a star that crosses the night sky like a bolt of lightning? That is me, Tecumseh, the one who leaps great distances.
You see a star that crosses the night sky like a bolt of lightning? That is me, Tecumseh, the one who leaps great distances.
We will drive you back to the sea, to the caves, to whatever place you have come from.
Let it be taken, our homes and our land given to us by the Great Spirit? The places we bury the ones who have gone home? Never!
A death song has come to me and I am going to sing it. When I am done, I will go to where the snows of winter go, where you cannot reach.
Deal. Donâ€™t make us regret it.
